org.myrobotlab.service.interfaces

Interface ServoControl

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Servo

    public interface ServoControl

      moveTo moves the servo to a specific location.
      boolean setController(ServoController controller)
      Attach a servo controller to the servo.
      boolean setController(java.lang.String controller) 
      void setMinMax(int min, int max)
      limits input of servo - to prevent damage or problems if servos should not move thier full range
      boolean setPin(int pin)
      memory of the controllers pin - so that it can be re-attached after a detach
      void setSpeed(java.lang.Float speed) 
      void stop()
      stops the servo if currently in motion servo must be moving at incremental speed for a stop to work (setSpeed < 1.0)

      • moveTo

        void moveTo(java.lang.Integer newPos)
        moveTo moves the servo to a specific location. Typically, a servo has 0 to 180 positions
        Parameters:
        newPos -

      • setController

        boolean setController(ServoController controller)
        Attach a servo controller to the servo. The servo and servo controller "should be in the same instance of MRL and this reference to another service should be ok. The servo controller uses this method to pass a reference of itself to the servo, to be used directly.

      • setController

        boolean setController(java.lang.String controller)

      • setMinMax

        void setMinMax(int min,
               int max)
        limits input of servo - to prevent damage or problems if servos should not move thier full range
        Parameters:
        max -

      • setPin

        boolean setPin(int pin)
        memory of the controllers pin - so that it can be re-attached after a detach
        Returns:

      • setSpeed

        void setSpeed(java.lang.Float speed)

      • stop

        void stop()
        stops the servo if currently in motion servo must be moving at incremental speed for a stop to work (setSpeed < 1.0)
